I try to guess what they are saying from the facial expressions and the

Today was better than yesterday. In the morning a delivery boy came to bring my food supplies.
Did you get a chance to communicate with the delivery boy?
Yes, I did. I used pen and paper to write I was pleased to see him, especially amid the stay-home restrictions due to the pandemic.

Good idea! How do you find new books to listen to?

Yes, I received a letter in the mail.
A letter from someone you know?
Yes, it was from my granddaughter.
That's great! Did you have any difficulty reading the letter?
No, I can still read without glasses, although sometimes I have trouble seeing small print.
And did you write back to your granddaughter?
Yes, I dictated a letter for my caregiver to write down and send for me.
That's a great way to communicate. Do you often use dictation?
Well, sometimes it's difficult for me to write because of my arthritis.
I understand that can be challenging
How was your day today?

Is there anything interesting or challenging that happened today when talking to someone?
Yes, I talked to my grandson on the phone. It's was really challenging, I always struggle with understanding him.
Did something specific happen? Was it because of grammar, language, speed or accent?
It was mostly the speed of his talking and also some words that he pronounced differently than what I'm used to.
What did you do to communicate better with him?
I asked him to speak slower, and I tried to piece together what he was saying by using the context of the conversation.

I'm feeling okay. Trying to find ways to occupy myself during the lockdown has been pretty tough.

Well, I spend a lot of time caring for my plants and doing a bit of cooking - I still measure my ingredients with great care.

Not really, I have my hearing aids on and the font size isn't too small for me to read.

I do enjoy watching Netflix on my iPad since I can make the subtitles larger.

Sometimes I have difficulty hearing them if they don't speak loud enough or clearly but I try to let them know to communicate clearly and it helps a lot.

Yes, I tried to call my old friend on the phone.

The conversation did not go on well since I didn't use my hearing aids, I forgot.

Yes, I should acknowledge wearing the hearing equipment all the times to remember communicating better.
